subject: Ser Sheldon of House Cooper
event: GAME OF THRONES is suddenly all over television. There was a reference on CASTLE. And another on GREY'S ANATOMY. And now... keep your eyes on BIG BANG THEORY, boys and girls. Yes, that's Longclaw. From the good folks at Valyrian Steel: http://www.valyriansteel.com/

comments.article:
OH MY GOD IN BIG BANG.

*grins like an idiot*

So what is House Cooper's heraldry? ;-D

(I am so going to watch that episode.)
A hand giving a Vulcan greeting on a redshirt background. :)
*drools*
haha, my husband and I LOST IT when it was on Grey's Anatomy.  Especially because it made absolutely no sense.  Kempner looks NOTHING like Daenerys.  :p
I might actually watch Big Bang Theory just to see this scene. I think it's great that A Game of Thrones is getting such publicity.
Love it!!

comments.upictitle: I joined the Rebel Alliance ironically: sheldon lab supervillain - by kasiopeia
comments.article: Longclaw on BBT? I have reached nerdvana!
hmmmm makes me wonder how spoilery the conversation will get! how jon's rank is referred to, shall we say, will determine whether sheldon has read the books or just watched the show!
The Grey's one was really silly but still awesome!
Best product placement I've ever seen.
That is just too cool.
Awesome, Nathan Fillion was also talking about it on his twitter feed, and how he wants to be on the show :)
oops just read this after I posted! heh
Oddly enough I was just reading Feast for Crows after watching several episodes of Big Bang with the wife and couldn't help to think of Sheldon reading ASoIaF.

There was also a reference in the last Rifftrax Live event - a character in the film (Jack the Giant Killer) said something along the lines of "Who will be my heir?" and Mike Nelson riffed "Not that Joffrey kid - he's creepy!"

I was one a quite a few who laughed :-)
Do you know what episode this aired on ?
comments.subject: What espisode ?

comments.upictitle: Wandering...Or Is It Wondering?: Zelda 4 {Link is happy!}
comments.article:
Not exactly a spoiler, but it pays to be safe on the rabid Interwebs.

The most recent episode of Supernatural from last Friday appeared to end with its own tribute as well--a character got "crowned" with piping hot nacho cheese, which had numerous people on my friends list cracking up and tossing out ASoIaF love. For some reason this episode was packed with wonderfully geeky refs (the cheese scene was not long after another person in the episode used the name of a popular Doctor Who character), so I was pretty much rolling by the time the "crowning" came around! Guess it's true that everything's better with cheese. :D Including cheese(y TV shows).
comments.subject: Uh...might not wanna read if you haven't seen the latest episode of Supernatural, guys!

comments.article: I'm glad my hubby and I weren't the only ones guffawing about the character's name choice. :D (And yes, I made the Cheese connection, too, but I don't know for sure that it was an intentional reference. :) )

OMG!!!!
This one had to come. Would have been a shame if Big Bang missed a GoT reference!
Nathan Fillion tweeted about making the reference because he wants to be on Game of Thrones! It makes me happy to see so many people getting to enjoy the greatness that is....
The first season is also being re-run in the UK on Sky Atlantic, if you want to big that up - Sundays at 9 from last Sunday (the 9th) and Saturday nights at 11:20 from the 15th.
